alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Southern Baltimore (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 07 at 6:02PM EST until January 10 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Southern Baltimore and Anne Arundel Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Tuesday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 4.2 feet, the boardalk at Annapolis City Dock is underwater. Floodwaters also are affecting numerous roads in Annapolis and on the Naval Academy Campus, along with structures throughout the neighboring area. At 5.0 feet, several roads in downtown Baltimore are flooded, along with the Pier 4 promenade on the east side, and much of the lower Inner Harbor area. At 3.8 feet, water covers yards and approaches homes in the Bowleys Quarters area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 4 feet above normal. The next high tide at Annapolis U.S. Naval Academy is at 1:21 AM and 3:09 PM. The next high tide at Fort McHenry Baltimore is at 3:04 AM and 4:17 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
